page.title: 08Interview- a local farmer
page.content: Mr Woolgrove is the 3rd generation on his farm.He has 400 acres,owns 500 she- ep and grows wheat,barley and turnips. In the Autumn and Spring he uses chemi- cals to control weeds.On his land he has got 1 small wood and 1 piece that floods he leaves those for wildlife.He owns a combine harvester,4 tractors and a bailer.They own 100 acres and pay re- nt on the rest.They have got 1 farm wo- rker who works full time.He lives in the village.At harvest time he clears his fields of the old straw and takes it away then he subsoils and ploughs and puts a multicultivator through it. Then he plants,harrows and rolls.The crops that he grows are sent to Wykham Mill.The other seed goes to a firm cal- led Facenda Chickens.The sheep are sold in Banbury Market.The E.E.C. helps Mr Woolgrove to know what sort of price he should get for his sheep.
